comment._content:
Leonard Patrick Vernon, b. 1894 at Grove Park South, Wrexham, was the son of Captain W H Vernon.  The family home in 1911 was at 26 Brighton Grove, Rusholme, Manchester.  Leonard Patrick Vernon attended Manchester University in 1913 reading Banking, he was a member of the University OTC 1913 to Sep 1914.  He was, in some capacity as a Clerk, connected with the National Provincial Bank of England.  He enlisted in the ranks of the 20th (University and Public Schools) Battalion Royal Fusiliers on 3 Sep 1914.

Subsequently commissioned into the Royal Welch Fusiliers, he was promoted to Temporary Lieutenant in 12th Battalion RWF on 20 Jul 1916, [London Gazette 29896 dated 9 Jan 1917].  Awarded his MC as a Lieutenant.  He was killed in action with 10th Battalion RWF defending the gentle, fire swept, rise of Infantry Hill (Hill 100) on the Somme on 18 Jun 1917.

Leonard Patrick Vernon may have had two sisters, one named Grace.//
